SUBROUTINE add_edge(a, b, edges)
   implicit none
   integer, intent(in) :: a, b
   type(adjacency_info), dimension(:), intent(inout) :: edges
   integer :: enlargen_a, enlargen_b
   integer :: new_a, new_b

   ! Enlarge array for a's list as needed
   if(.NOT. allocated(edges(a)%list)) then
      allocate(edges(a)%list(10))  ! initial buffer of size 10, but can change
   else if( edges(a)%count +1 > size(edges(a)%list )) then
      ! double the allocated size
      integer :: new_size, i
      new_size = max(10, size(edges(a)%list))*2
      integer, dimension(new_size) :: tmp
      tmp(1: size(edges(a)%list) ) = edges(a)%list(1: edges(a)%count )
      deallocate(edges(a)%list)
      allocate(edges(a)%list(new_size))
      edges(a)%list(1:edges(a)%count) = tmp(1:edges(a)%count)
      deallocate(tmp)
   end if

   edges(a)%count = edges(a)%count +1
   edges(a)%list(edges(a)%count) = b

   ! Now do the same for the edge from b to a:
   if(a /=b) then
      if(.NOT. allocated(edges(b)%list)) then
         allocate(edges(b)%list(10))
      else if( edges(b)%count +1 > size(edges(b)%list)) then
         integer :: new_size
         new_size = max(10, size(edges(b)%list )) *2
         integer, dimension(new_size) :: tmp
!         print*, "resizing b's list from/to", size(edges(b)%list), new_size
         tmp(1:edges(b)%count) = edges(b)%list(1:edges(b)%count )
         deallocate(edges(b)%list)
         allocate(edges(b)%list(new_size))
         edges(b)%list(1:edges(b)%count) = tmp(1:edges(b)%count)
         deallocate(tmp)
      end if
      edges(b)%count = edges(b)%count +1
      edges(b)%list(edges(b)%count) = a
   end if
end subroutine add_edge

   implicit none
   integer, intent(in) :: u
   type(adjacency_info), dimension(:), intent(in) :: edges
   integer, dimension(:), intent(inout) :: dist

Subroutine dfs_iterative(u, edges, dist)

   implicit none
   integer, intent(in) :: u
   type(adjacency_info), dimension( : ), intent(in) :: edges
   integer, dimension( : ), intent(inout) :: dist
   integer, dimension( : ), allocatable :: stack
   integer :: top, current_node, i, v

   allocate( stack( N ) ) ! Maximum possible depth is N

   dist(u) =0

   top =0
   stack(top+1) = u
   top = top+1
   dist(u) =0

   do while ( top >0 )
      current_node = stack(top)
      top = top -1
      do i=1, edges(current_node)%count
         v = edges(current_node)%list(i)
         if( dist(v) == INF ) then
             dist(v) = dist(current_node) + 1
             top = top+1
             stack(top) = v
         end if
      end do
   end do
end subroutine

subroutine BFS( s, edges, dist )

   implicit none

   integer, intent(in) :: s

   type(adjacency_info), dimension( : ), intent( in ) :: edges

   integer, dimension( : ), intent( inout ) :: dist

   integer :: qmax_size = N, front=1, rear=1 

   integer, dimension( N ) :: queue 

   dist(s )= 0

   queue(1)= s

   do while ( front <= rear )

      integer :: current_node = queue( front )

      front = front+1

      do i=1, edges(current_node)%count

        v = edges(current_node)%list(i)

        if( dist(v) == INF ) then

          dist( v )= dist(current_node)+1

          rear = rear +1

          queue(rear) = v

        end if 

      end do 

   end do 

end subroutine

Alternatively, allocate dynamically:

subroutine BFS( s, edges, dist )
   implicit none
   integer, intent(in) :: s
   type(adjacency_info), dimension( : ), intent(in) :: edges
   integer, dimension( : ), intent(inout) :: dist
   integer, dimension( : ), allocatable :: queue
   integer :: front, rear, front_initial, rear_initial, current_node, i, v, N
   N = size(edges) ! assuming edges size is N, the number of nodes.

   allocate( queue( N ) ) ! maximum queue size is N (tree case)

   dist(s) =0
   front =1
   rear =1
   queue(1) = s

   do while ( front <= rear )
      current_node = queue( front )
      front = front +1
      do i=1, edges(current_node)%count
         v = edges(current_node)%list(i)
         if( dist( v ) == INF ) then
            dist(v)= dist(current_node) +1
            rear= rear +1
            queue( rear )= v
         end if
      end do
   end do
   deallocate(queue)
end subroutine BFS

This way, the queue is allocated as large as N, which works for tree BFS.

type adjacency_info
   integer :: count =0
   integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: list
end type adjacency_info

integer, parameter :: INF = 2147483647  ! Maximum value.

subroutine add_edge(a, b, edges)
   implicit none
   integer, intent(in) :: a, b
   type(adjacency_info), dimension(:), intent(inout) :: edges
   ! Adds a bidirectional edge from a to b and b to a in the adjacency lists.
   integer :: new_size, i
   if ( .not. allocated(edges(a)%list) ) then
      allocate(edges(a)%list(10))  ! Initial capacity of 10
   else if ( edges(a)%count +1 > size(edges(a)%list) ) then
      new_size = 2 * size(edges(a)%list)
      allocate(edges(a)%list(new_size), source=edges(a)%list)
      ! Or:
      ! Need to copy previous contents.
      ! Use source= to do the copy.
      ! (This is a better way in Fortran 2003+)
      ! New method:
      !原 edges(a)%list 는 현재 값들을 복사를 하여 새 array에 할당 재배치해야.
   else
      ! blocking here only for allocation, but if no need to BQ resize.
   end if
   edges(a)%count = edges(a)%count +1
   edges(a)%list(edges(a)%count) = b

   ! Now add the opposite edge, unless it's a self-loop (which isn't possible in a tree)
   if (a /= b) then
      if ( .not. allocated(edges(b)%list) ) then
         allocate(edges(b)%list(10))
      else if ( edges(b)%count +1 > size(edges(b)%list) ) then
         new_size = 2 * size(edges(b)%list)
         allocate(edges(b)%list(new_size), source=edges(b)%list)
      end if
      edges(b)%count = edges(b)%count +1
      edges(b)%list(edges(b)%count) =a
   end if
end subroutine add_edge

subroutine BFS(s, edges, dist)
   implicit none
   integer, intent(in) :: s
   type(adjacency_info), dimension(:), intent(in) :: edges
   integer, dimension(:), intent(inout) :: dist
   integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: queue
   integer :: front, rear, current_node, i, v, N
   N = size(edges)
   allocate(queue(N))  ! Allocate a queue of size N.
   dist(s) =0
   front =1
   rear =1
   queue(1) =s
   do while(front <= rear)
      current_node = queue(front)
      front = front +1
      do i =1, edges(current_node)%count
         v = edges(current_node)%list(i)
         if ( dist(v) == INF ) then
            dist(v) = dist(current_node) +1
            rear = rear +1
            queue(rear) =v
         end if
      end do
   end do
   deallocate(queue)
end subroutine BFS

   allocate(d(N))

   call BFS(u, edges, d)
   call BFS(v, edges, e)

   q = -1
   do i =1,N
      if(d(i) <e(i)) then

      end if
   end do

   if(q <=0) then
      print'(i0)',0
   else
      print'(i0)', q-1
   end if

end program ABC148
